title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 68.13 - Seals
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 68.13 - Seals

State Regulations

For those applicants initially applying for licensure on or
after July 1984, seals used by licensed professional engineers, land surveyors
and professional geologists shall be circular in shape, approximately 1 3/4
inches in diameter, bearing the legend at the top of the outer band, "STATE OF
NEW YORK" and at the bottom "LICENSED PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER" or "LICENSED LAND
SURVEYOR" or "LICENSED PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER AND LAND SURVEYOR" or "LICENSED
PROFESSIONAL GEOLOGIST" as the case may be. In the circle above the Great Seal
of New York shall be shown the name of the licensee, and below the Great Seal
the license number with no other letters or numbers. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
68.13

Renumbered from 68.10

New

York State Register July 27, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 30, eff. 11/21/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
